content.question: Which of the following developments best explains changes in agricultural production in the United States during the 1880s and 1890s?

choices.label: New systems of transportation integrated farming into national markets.
Farmers established new plantations for commercial crops such as cotton and tobacco.
The Civil War devastated farms in large portions of the South.
Commercial farms increasingly relied on labor provided by immigrants.

content.answer: New systems of transportation integrated farming into national markets.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
